meanings.definition: To bounce back after hitting a surface.
meanings.sent1: The ball rebounds off the wall.
meanings.sent2: After falling, he quickly rebounds and stands up.
meanings.sent3: The rubber ball always rebounds when thrown on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm rebounds after a brief moment of disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The boxer rebounds from a punch and counterattacks.

meanings.definition: To recover from a setback or failure.
meanings.sent1: She rebounds from a tough loss and continues to work hard.
meanings.sent2: After a difficult period, he rebounds and achieves success.
meanings.sent3: His mood rebounds after a disappointing day at work.
meanings.sent4: The team rebounds from a losing streak with a series of wins.
meanings.sent5: He rebounds from a mistake by learning from it and improving.

meanings.definition: The act of bouncing back after hitting a surface.
meanings.sent1: The rebound of the ball off the floor was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The rebound of the tennis ball off the racket was swift.
meanings.sent3: The rebound of the ball off the wall surprised the players.
meanings.sent4: The rebound of the basketball off the backboard led to a score.
meanings.sent5: The rebound of the ball off the ground was high and energetic.

meanings.definition: The recovery of a basketball after a missed shot.
meanings.sent1: The player grabbed the rebound and passed it to a teammate.
meanings.sent2: The rebound was crucial in giving the team another scoring opportunity.
meanings.sent3: The rebound of the ball after a missed shot changed the game's momentum.
meanings.sent4: The rebound off the rim was caught by the opposing team.
meanings.sent5: The rebound secured by the center helped the team maintain possession.
